Introduction: Fungal infections are any disease you get from a fungus. They affect your skin, hair, nails, mucous membranes, lungs or other parts of your body.
Remedies: 1. Eat Yoghurt and Probiotics 2. Wash with Soap and Water 3. Use Apple Cider Vinegar 4. Use Tea Tree Oil

Introduction: Allergies occur when your immune system reacts to a foreign substance � such as pollen, bee venom
Remedies: Avoiding allergens,Taking a steam shower,Getting enough rest,Eating a healthy diet

Introduction: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) occurs when stomach acid repeatedly flows back into the tube connecting your mouth and stomach (esophagus).
Remedies: Eating smaller meals,Raising the head of the bed,Avoiding tight-fitting clothing,Drinking herbal tea

Introduction: Cholestasis is a liver disease. It occurs when the flow of bile from your liver is reduced or blocked. Bile is fluid produced by your liver that aids in the digestion of food, especially fats.
Remedies: Eating a healthy diet,Avoiding alcohol,Exercise regularly,Stay hydrated,Milk thistle

Introduction: Adverse drug reactions (adverse effects) are any unwanted effects of drugs . Mild or moderate adverse drug reactions do not necessarily mean that people must stop taking a medication, especially if no suitable alternative is available.
Remedies: Discontinue the medication,Take an antihistamine,Use over-the-counter creams,take an antihistamine:

Introduction: A perforation or hole in the lining of the small intestine, lower oesophagus or stomach.peptic ulcers can result in: Internal bleeding. Bleeding can occur as slow blood loss that leads to anemia
Remedies: Eating a healthy diet,Avoiding trigger foods,Quitting smoking,Reducing stress,Drinking chamomile tea

Introduction: A viral infection that attacks the immune system and causes AIDS. HIV is primarily a sexually transmitted disease (STD), transmitted by heterosexual and homosexual practices: anal, vaginal, and oral sex.
Remedies: Stress reduction,Adequate sleep,Avoid alcohol and drugs,Healthy diet

Introduction: Diabetes is a chronic disease that occurs either when the pancreas does not produce enough insulin or when the body cannot effectively use the insulin it produces.
Remedies: Medications,Blood sugar monitoring,Diet and exercise

Introduction: gastroenteritis is an intestinal infection that includes signs and symptoms such as watery diarrhea, stomach cramps, nausea or vomiting, and sometimes fever.
Remedies: Peppermint,Ginger,Eating bland foods,Rest,Stay Hydrated

Introduction: A lung disorder characterised by narrowing of the airways, the tubes which carry air into the lungs, that are inflamed and constricted, causing shortness of breath, wheezing and cough.
Remedies: 1.Gargling salt water may help break up mucus and reduce pain in your throat,2.regular breathing exercises can help reduce asthma symptoms

Introduction: High pressure in the arteries (vessels that carry blood from the heart to the rest of the body). Symptoms varies from person to person and generally include unexplained fatigue and headache.
Remedies: 1. Lose extra pounds and watch your waistline,2. Exercise regularly,3. Eat a healthy diet,4. Reduce sodium in your diet,5. Limit the amount of alcohol you drink

Introduction: A migraine is a headache that can cause severe throbbing pain or a pulsing sensation, usually on one side of the head. It's often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and extreme sensitivity to light and sound.
Remedies: 1. Apply a cold compress If you�ve ever put an ice pack on an injury or a heating pad on a sore back,2.Acupressure. Acupressure involves applying pressure to specific parts of the body.

Introduction: Cervical spondylosis is a common condition that affects the neck as we age, causing pain, stiffness, and headaches.
Remedies: Regular Exercise,2. Cervical Traction,3. Hot and Cold Compresses,4. Epsom Salt Bath,5. Massage.

Introduction: Intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH) is when blood suddenly bursts into brain tissue, causing damage to your brain.If a blood vessel in the brain leaks or bursts and causes bleeding, a hemorrhagic stroke occurs.
Remedies: Essential oils,Massage,Yoga and meditation,Exercise

Introduction: Jaundice (also called icterus) is when the skin and the whites of the eyes become a yellow color. People with jaundice have a problem with their liver, which stops it from removing heme properly.
Remedies: Consuming turmeric,Drinking lemon water,Avoiding alcohol and processed foods,

Introduction: Malaria is a life-threatening disease caused by parasites that are transmitted to people through the bites of infected female Anopheles mosquitoes. It is preventable and curable
Remedies: Taking herbal supplements,Using natural remedies,Eating a healthy diet,Drinking fluids

Introduction: Chickenpox is an infection that causes a skin rash. The disease is caused by a germ called varicella-zoster virus.Chickenpox primarily occurs in children under 10 years of age but can affect the adults as well
Remedies: Vitamin E oil,Cool compresses,Baking soda,Oatmeal baths

Introduction: Dengue fever is a mosquito-borne tropical disease caused by the dengue virus. Symptoms typically begin three to fourteen days after infection
Remedies: Rest,Hydration,Monitor blood platelet count

Introduction: Typhoid is an infection caused by Salmonella bacteria. Symptoms include a high fever of up to 104�F, diarrhea, and vomiting. It can be life threatening if a person does not have early treatment with antibiotics.
Remedies: 1.Antibiotics,2.Hydration,3.Rest,4.Proper nutrition,5.Fever management

Introduction: Hepatitis A is a highly contagious liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus. The virus is one of several types of hepatitis viruses that cause liver inflammation and affect your liver's ability to function.
Remedies: 1.Vaccination,2.Hydration,3.Rest,4.Proper nutrition,5.Fever management

Introduction: Hepatitis B is a serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus (HBV). For most people, hepatitis B is short term, also called acute,Having chronic hepatitis B increases your risk of developing liver failure, liver cancer or cirrhosis, a condition that permanently scars the liver.
Remedies: 1.Antiviral medications,2.Hydration,3.Rest,4.Proper nutrition,5.vaccination,6.Monitoring liver function

Introduction: Hepatitis C is a viral infection that causes liver inflammation, sometimes leading to serious liver damage. The hepatitis C virus (HCV) spreads through contaminated blood.
Remedies: 1.Antiviral medications,2.Hydration,3.Rest,4.Proper nutrition,5.vaccination,6.Monitoring liver function

Introduction: Hepatitis D is an inflammation of the liver caused by the hepatitis D virus (HDV), which requires HBV for its replication. Hepatitis D infection cannot occur in the absence of hepatitis B virus.
Remedies: 1.Antiviral medications,2.Hydration,3.Rest,4.Proper nutrition,5.vaccination,6.Monitoring liver function

Introduction: Hepatitis E is inflammation of the liver caused by the hepatitis E virus (HEV). The virus has at least 4 different types: genotypes 1, 2, 3 and 4. Genotypes 1 and 2 have been found only in humans. Genotypes 3 and 4 circulate in several animals including pigs, wild boars and deer without causing any disease, and occasionally infect humans.
Remedies: Stay hydrated,Avoid alcoholTurmeric,Eat a healthy diet

Introduction: Alcoholic hepatitis is inflammation of the liver caused by drinking alcohol. Alcoholic hepatitis is most likely to occur in people who drink heavily over many years. However, the relationship between drinking and alcoholic hepatitis is complex.
Remedies: Stop drinking alcohol,Healthy diet,Turmeric,Exercise

Introduction: Tuberculosis is an infectious disease that can cause infection in your lungs or other tissues. It commonly affects your lungs, but it can also affect other organs like your spine, brain or kidneys
Remedies: Garlic,Ginger,Turmeric,Good nutrition

Introduction: The common cold is a viral infection of your nose and throat (upper respiratory tract). It's usually harmless, although it might not feel that way. Many types of viruses can cause a common cold.
Remedies: Drink plenty of fluids,Gargle with salt water,Drink warm fluids,Rest

Introduction: Pneumonia is a type of lung infection that affects one or both lungs. It is caused by a variety of microorganisms, including bacteria, viruses, and fungi.
Remedies: Stay hydrated,Get plenty of rest,Use a humidifier,Steam inhalation

Introduction: Hemorrhoids are swollen veins in the rectal area that can cause discomfort, pain, itching, and bleeding
Remedies: Warm bath,Ice packs,Fiber rich diet,hydration

Introduction: occurs when the blood flow to the heart is blocked, usually by a blood clot. This can cause damage to the heart muscle and can be life-threatening.
Remedies: healthy lifestyle, including a balanced diet, regular physical activity, avoiding smoking,

Introduction: Varicose veins are swollen, twisted veins that often appear dark purple or blue in color, and are most commonly found in the legs
Remedies: Exercise,Elevate your legs,Weight management,Avoid prolonged sitting or standing

Introduction: Hypothyroidism is a condition in which the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormones
Remedies: Eat a balanced diet,Exercise regularly,Get enough sleep

Introduction: Hyperthyroidism is a condition in which the thyroid gland produces an excessive amount of thyroid hormones.
Remedies: Ashwagandha,Coconut oil,Coconut oil,Stress management:

Introduction: Hypoglycemia is a condition in which the blood sugar levels in the body become too low
Remedies: Eat small, frequent meals,Consume complex carbohydrates,Avoid simple sugars,Exercise regularly

Introduction: Osteoarthritis is a common joint condition that occurs when the cartilage that cushions the joints breaks down, causing pain, stiffness, and swelling.
Remedies: Maintain a healthy weight,Exercise regularly,Apply heat or cold,Practice relaxation techniques

Introduction: Arthritis is a condition that causes inflammation in the joints, resulting in pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility.
Remedies: Get enough sleep,Take supplements,Maintain a healthy weight,Exercise regularly

Introduction: Paroxysmal positional vertigo (PPV) is a type of vertigo that occurs when there is a change in the position of the head.
Remedies: Sit still,Practice balance exercises,Stay hydrated,Avoid bright lights

Introduction: Acne is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells, resulting in pimples, blackheads, and whiteheads
Remedies: Keep skin clean,Avoid touching your face,Apply tea tree oil,Apply aloe vera,Use Honey

Introduction: A urinary tract infection (UTI) is a common infection that occurs in any part of the urinary system, including the kidneys, bladder, ureters, and urethra.
Remedies: Drinking plenty of water,Drinking cranberry juice,Using a heating pad,Avoiding irritants

Introduction: Psoriasis is a chronic autoimmune condition that affects the skin. It causes the skin cells to multiply too quickly, resulting in the formation of thick, scaly patches on the skin
Remedies: Moisturize the skin,Take warm baths,Apply natural oils,Use aloe vera

Introduction: Impetigo (im-puh-TIE-go) is a common and highly contagious skin infection that mainly affects infants and young children. It usually appears as reddish sores on the face, especially around the nose and mouth and on the hands and feet.
Remedies: Keep the affected area clean,Apply honey,Apply apple cider vinegar,Use garlic
